subject: Re: [junit] Remote debugging a JUNIT test case
msgSnippet: Hello David, Thanks for your reply. I am able to debug remotely other Java applications but not JUnit as you correctly indicated. Unfortunately, I am no closer
messageBody:
Hello David,

Thanks for your reply. I am able to debug remotely other Java applications
but not JUnit as you correctly indicated. Unfortunately, I am no closer to a
solution. I wonder has anyone else sucessfully debugged remotely their
JUNIT and if so how :-)

Thanks for bumping up my question ;-)


On 8/9/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> David,
>
> I hope you've gotten closer to a solution. Are you able to remotely
> debug other Java applications, but not JUnit? Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
>
> novotique wrote:
> > Hello all,
> >
> > Firstly, I want to say that this is a fantastic forum! I have been
> > using it for only one year now but in that short space of time you
> > have all helped me not only to write better tests but to also be a
> > better developer.
> >
> > Now to my problem :-) I searched for a solution to this but all in
> > vain. Essentially I want to execute a JUNIT test on a unix box
> > remotely while connecting to the JVM using eclipse on my windows
> > machine with the intention of debugging.
> >
> > How do I launch my JUNIT with a debug option on the command line? I
> > don't want to use ANT. The problem I have is that we develop on
> > windows but the application is designed to run solely on some
> > different flavours of unix (mostly HP-UX).
> >
> > All our tests run automatically at night after the daily build but
> > sometimes the tests will fail on unix and pass on windows. Ideally,
> > the solution would be to develop and test on unix but this is not
> > permitted due certain limitations beyond my control.
> >
> > Any help would be very much appreciated.
> > regards,
> > David.
